title: Portmanteau Words
description: Identify words made by blending two words together!

questions.question: The word 'brunch' is a blend of which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Brunch' is a blend of 'breakfast' and 'lunch,' referring to a late morning meal that combines elements of both. The word was first used in the 1890s in Britain.

questions.question: Which two words make up the portmanteau 'smog'?
questions.explanation: 'Smog' combines 'smoke' and 'fog.' It was coined in 1905 by Dr. Henry Antoine Des Voeux to describe the thick, polluted air in British cities.

questions.question: The word 'motel' is a blend of which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Motel' is a blend of 'motor' and 'hotel,' describing a roadside hotel designed for motorists. The term was first used in 1925 in San Luis Obispo, California.

questions.question: Which two words form the portmanteau 'email'?
questions.explanation: 'Email' is a blend of 'electronic' and 'mail.' While the concept dates to the 1960s, the term 'email' became widely used in the 1990s with the rise of the internet.

questions.question: The word 'spork' combines which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Spork' is a blend of 'spoon' and 'fork,' describing the hybrid utensil that combines features of both. The word has been in use since at least the early 1900s.

questions.question: Which two words make up the portmanteau 'blog'?
questions.explanation: 'Blog' is a blend of 'web' and 'log.' The term 'weblog' was coined in 1997, and by 1999 the shortened form 'blog' had become the standard word.

questions.question: The word 'electrocute' is a portmanteau of which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Electrocute' is a blend of 'electric' and 'execute.' It was coined in 1889 when New York introduced the electric chair as a method of execution.

questions.question: Which two words form the portmanteau 'chortle'?
questions.explanation: 'Chortle' blends 'chuckle' and 'snort.' It was invented by Lewis Carroll in 'Through the Looking-Glass' (1871). Carroll also coined the term 'portmanteau' for this type of word blend.

questions.question: The word 'Tanzania' is a portmanteau of which two place names?
questions.explanation: 'Tanzania' is a blend of 'Tanganyika' and 'Zanzibar.' When the two nations united in 1964, they combined their names to form Tanzania.

questions.question: Which two words make up the portmanteau 'infomercial'?
questions.explanation: 'Infomercial' combines 'information' and 'commercial,' describing a long-form television advertisement presented as informational content. The term emerged in the 1980s.

questions.question: The word 'sitcom' is a portmanteau of which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Sitcom' is a blend of 'situation' and 'comedy.' The term describes a genre of comedy centered on a fixed set of characters in a consistent setting, popular since the early days of television.

questions.question: Which two words form the portmanteau 'gerrymandering'?
questions.explanation: 'Gerrymandering' combines 'Gerry' (Governor Elbridge Gerry) and 'salamander.' In 1812, a newly drawn electoral district in Massachusetts was said to resemble a salamander, leading to the political term.

questions.question: The word 'pixel' is a portmanteau of which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Pixel' blends 'picture' and 'element.' Coined in the 1960s, it describes the smallest addressable element in a digital display or image.

questions.question: Which two words make up the portmanteau 'Oxbridge'?
questions.explanation: 'Oxbridge' is a blend of 'Oxford' and 'Cambridge,' used to refer to both prestigious English universities collectively. The term has been in use since the 1840s.

questions.question: The word 'podcast' is a portmanteau of which two words?
questions.explanation: 'Podcast' blends 'iPod' (Apple's media player) and 'broadcast.' The term was coined by journalist Ben Hammersley in 2004, though podcasts can be listened to on any device, not just iPods.
